results.title: Statins Inhibit Toll-Like Receptor 4-Mediated Growth of Human Esophageal Adenocarcinoma Cells.
results.text_hl: METHODS: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Human@@@ @<m>DISEASE_Adenocarcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000230 @@@EAC@@@ cells (@CELLLINE_CVCL:0471 @@@OE33@@@ and @CELLLINE_CVCL:2045 @@@FLO1@@@) were treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ or @CHEMICAL_Atorvastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D000069059 @@@atorvastatin@@@ for increasing doses and time periods.

citations.NLM: Gergen AK, Kohtz PD, Halpern AL, White AM, Meng X, Fullerton DA, Weyant MJ. Statins Inhibit Toll-Like Receptor 4-Mediated Growth of Human Esophageal Adenocarcinoma Cells. J Surg Res. 2021 Apr;260():436-447. PMID: 33272595

results.title: Adjuvant statin therapy for oesophageal adenocarcinoma: the STAT-ROC feasibility study
results.text_hl: This multicentre, double-blind, parallel-group, placebo-controlled trial has reported outcomes for 32 participants randomized to @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ 40 mg or placebo to determine the feasibility of adjuvant statin therapy in @SPECIES_9606 @@@patients@@@ with operable @<m>DISEASE_Adenocarcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000230 @@@OAC@@@ in a future phase III trial.

citations.NLM: Alexandre L, Clark AB, Walton S, Lewis MP, Kumar B, Cheong EC, Warren H, Kadirkamanathan SS, Parsons SL, Dresner SM, Sims E, Jones M, Hammond M, Flather M, Loke YK, Swart AM, Hart AR. Adjuvant statin therapy for oesophageal adenocarcinoma: the STAT-ROC feasibility study BJS Open. 2020 Feb;4(1):59-70. PMID: 32011825

results.title: Simvastatin Inhibits Histologic Changes Associated with Gastroduodenal Reflux in a Murine Model.
results.text_hl: METHODS: @SPECIES_9606 @@@Human@@@ @DISEASE_Barrett_Esophagus @DISEASE_MESH:D001471 @@@Barrett's@@@ (CPB) and @<m>DISEASE_Adenocarcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000230 @@@esophageal adenocarcinoma@@@ (@CELLLINE_CVCL:2045 @@@FLO1@@@ and @CELLLINE_CVCL:1622 @@@OE19@@@) cells were treated with @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

results.title: Isoforms of RNF128 Regulate the Stability of Mutant P53 in Barrett's Esophageal Cells.
results.text_hl: Athymic nude @SPECIES_10090 @@@mice@@@ bearing @<m>DISEASE_Adenocarcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000230 @@@EAC@@@ xenograft @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumors@@@ (grown from @CELLLINE_CVCL:0471 @@@OE-33@@@ cells) were given intraperitoneal injections of @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@; @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumor@@@ growth was monitored and @DISEASE_Neoplasms @DISEASE_MESH:D009369 @@@tumors@@@ were collected and analyzed by immunoblotting for levels of @GENE_RNF128 @GENE_79589 @@@RNF128@@@, @GENE_TP53 @GENE_7157 @@@p53@@@, and acetylated @GENE_TP53 @GENE_7157 @@@p53@@@.

results.title: Simvastatin, but not pravastatin, inhibits the proliferation of esophageal adenocarcinoma and squamous cell carcinoma cells: a cell-molecular study
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@, but not @CHEMICAL_Pravastatin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017035 @@@pravastatin@@@, inhibits the proliferation of @<m>DISEASE_Adenocarcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000230 @@@esophageal adenocarcinoma@@@ and @DISEASE_Carcinoma_Squamous_Cell @DISEASE_MESH:D002294 @@@squamous cell carcinoma@@@ cells: a cell-molecular study

results.title: Statin therapy attenuates growth and malignant potential of human esophageal adenocarcinoma cells.
results.text_hl: These findings identify @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ as a potential therapeutic and chemopreventive modality to thwart the progression of @<m>DISEASE_Adenocarcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000230 @@@esophageal adenocarcinoma@@@.

citations.NLM: Sadaria MR, Reppert AE, Yu JA, Meng X, Fullerton DA, Reece TB, Weyant MJ. Statin therapy attenuates growth and malignant potential of human esophageal adenocarcinoma cells. J Thorac Cardiovasc Surg. 2011 Nov;142(5):1152-60. PMID: 22014341

results.text_hl: Inhibition of @<m>DISEASE_Adenocarcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000230 @@@Barret's adenocarcinoma@@@ cell growth by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@: involvement of @GENE_COX2 @GENE_4513 @@@COX-2@@@ and apoptosis-related proteins.

results.title: Simvastatin improves sepsis-induced mortality and acute kidney injury via renal vascular effects.
results.text_hl: @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@ attenuated CLP-induced @<m>DISEASE_Adenocarcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000230 @@@tubular damage@@@ and reversed CLP-induced reduction of intrarenal microvascular perfusion and @DISEASE_Hypoxia @DISEASE_MESH:D000860 @@@renal tubular hypoxia@@@ at 24 h.

results.title: Anti-carcinogenic activity of simvastatin during the promotion phase of radiation-induced mammary tumorigenesis of rats.
results.text_hl: The development of @<m>DISEASE_Adenocarcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000230 @@@adenocarcinoma@@@ in the control @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ was significantly higher than that in the @SPECIES_10116 @@@rats@@@ fed the @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@ diet.

citations.NLM: Inano H, Suzuki K, Onoda M, Wakabayashi K. Anti-carcinogenic activity of simvastatin during the promotion phase of radiation-induced mammary tumorigenesis of rats. Carcinogenesis. 1997 Sep;18(9):1723-7. PMID: 9328167

results.title: Simvastatin attenuates renal ischemia/reperfusion injury from oxidative stress via targeting Nrf2/HO-1 pathway.
results.text_hl: @CHEMICAL_Hematoxylin @CHEMICAL_MESH:D006416 @@@Hematoxylin@@@-eosin staining revealed no obvious morphological @DISEASE_Abnormalities_Drug_Induced @DISEASE_MESH:D000014 @@@abnormalities@@@ in the sham group, while I@DISEASE_Ring_Chromosome_20_Syndrome @DISEASE_MESH:C580424 @@@/R@@@ led to notable @<m>DISEASE_Adenocarcinoma</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000230 @@@tubular cell swelling@@@, vacuolization, cast formation and @DISEASE_Kidney_Tubular_Necrosis_Acute @DISEASE_MESH:D007683 @@@tubular necrosis@@@, which was rescued by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@.

citations.NLM: Zhang Y, Rong S, Feng Y, Zhao L, Hong J, Wang R, Yuan W. Simvastatin attenuates renal ischemia/reperfusion injury from oxidative stress via targeting Nrf2/HO-1 pathway. Exp Ther Med. 2017 Nov;14(5):4460-4466. PMID: 29067120
